com.topcoder.util.classassociations
Interface AssociationAlgorithm

All Known Implementing Classes:
DefaultAssociationAlgorithm
public interface AssociationAlgorithm

An object that can retrieve "Handlers" for specific targets. Each implementation offers different logic of determining which is the appropriate "Handler" to return.

Version:
1.0 3-28-2004
Author:
TCSDEVELOPER

Method Summary
 java.lang.Object retrieveHandler(ClassAssociator associator, java.lang.Class target)
          Retrieves a "handler" object for specified "target" object.
 

Method Detail

retrieveHandler

public java.lang.Object retrieveHandler(ClassAssociator associator,
                                        java.lang.Class target)

Retrieves a "handler" object for specified "target" object. The associations that were specified in ClassAssociator will be used to determine the appropriate "Handler" to return.

Valid: associator = any non-null ClassAssociator

Valid: target = any non-null Class

Invalid: associator = null (throws IllegalArgumentException)

Invalid: target = null (throws IllegalArgumentException)

Parameters:
associator - A ClassAssociator which contains the associations which are to be used by the algorithm.
target - The Class whose "Handler" you want to retrieve.
Returns:
A "Handler" object that is determined by the implementation of this interface. Or null if no appropriate handler can be found.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the given parameters is null.
